Questions.Question: Which 1994 movie stars Tom Hanks as Forrest Gump?
Questions.Explanation: Forrest Gump is a 1994 American comedy-drama film based on the 1986 novel of the same name by Winston Groom.

Questions.Question: Which actress portrayed the protagonist in 'Gone Girl'?
Questions.Explanation: Rosamund Pike plays the complex character Amy Dunne in the film adaptation of Gillian Flynn's best-selling novel 'Gone Girl'.

Questions.Question: Which literary classic inspired the film 'Clueless'?
Questions.Explanation: 'Clueless' is a modern retelling of Jane Austen's 1815 novel 'Emma', set in a Beverly Hills high school.

Questions.Question: Who wrote the 2002 novel adapted into the film 'The Hours'?
Questions.Explanation: Michael Cunningham's Pulitzer Prize-winning novel 'The Hours' was adapted into a critically acclaimed film in 2002.

Questions.Question: Which Shakespeare play was adapted into the 1996 film 'Romeo + Juliet'?
Questions.Explanation: Director Baz Luhrmann's film 'Romeo + Juliet' offers a modern, stylized take on the classic tragic love story.

Questions.Question: Who directed the film adaptation of 'The Great Gatsby' released in 2013?
Questions.Explanation: Baz Luhrmann directed the visually lavish adaptation of F. Scott Fitzgerald's timeless novel 'The Great Gatsby'.

Questions.Question: Which Stephen King novel inspired the film 'The Shawshank Redemption'?
Questions.Explanation: Frank Darabont's 'The Shawshank Redemption' is based on Stephen King's novella from his collection 'Different Seasons'.

Questions.Question: Who played the lead role in the film adaptation of 'Lolita' in 1962?
Questions.Explanation: James Mason portrayed the controversial character Humbert in Stanley Kubrick's adaptation of Vladimir Nabokov's novel.

Questions.Question: Which Charles Dickens novel is the basis for the 2019 film 'The Personal History of David Copperfield'?
Questions.Explanation: Armando Iannucci's film is a contemporary take on Dickens' novel, featuring Dev Patel in the lead role.

Questions.Question: What novel by Alice Walker was adapted into a film directed by Steven Spielberg in 1985?
Questions.Explanation: Steven Spielberg's adaptation of 'The Color Purple' received widespread acclaim and garnered several Academy Award nominations.

Questions.Question: Who portrayed the character 'Lisbeth Salander' in the 2011 film adaptation of 'The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo'?
Questions.Explanation: Rooney Mara's compelling portrayal of Lisbeth Salander earned critical praise and an Academy Award nomination.

Questions.Question: In 'Silence of the Lambs', what notable book does Hannibal Lecter frequently discuss?
Questions.Explanation: Hannibal Lecter discusses 'The Divine Comedy' by Dante Alighieri in the acclaimed film 'Silence of the Lambs'.

Questions.Question: Which literary classic inspired the film adaptation '10 Things I Hate About You'?
Questions.Explanation: Inspired by Shakespeare's play, '10 Things I Hate About You' is a modern high school romantic comedy.

Questions.Question: In the film 'The Princess Bride', what novel does the grandfather read to his grandson?
Questions.Explanation: The film's metafictional narrative involves a grandfather reading 'The Princess Bride' by William Goldman to his sick grandson.

Questions.Question: Who wrote the novel 'The Graduate', later adapted into the iconic film released in 1967?
Questions.Explanation: Charles Webb's novel provided the basis for Mike Nichols' critically acclaimed film 'The Graduate' starring Dustin Hoffman.

Questions.Question: What classic novel was the basis for the film adaptation 'Little Women' released in 2019?
Questions.Explanation: Greta Gerwig's adaptation brought Louisa May Alcott's beloved novel 'Little Women' to the screen with a fresh perspective.

Questions.Question: Who directed the adaptation of 'To Kill a Mockingbird' released in 1962?
Questions.Explanation: Robert Mulligan's adaptation of Harper Lee's classic novel 'To Kill a Mockingbird' won three Academy Awards including Best Actor for Gregory Peck.

Questions.Question: What literary work inspired the film 'Bridget Jones's Diary'?
Questions.Explanation: The film 'Bridget Jones's Diary' draws inspiration from Jane Austen's novel 'Pride and Prejudice', with a modern twist.

Questions.Question: Which Roald Dahl book became the basis for the film 'Matilda' released in 1996?
Questions.Explanation: Danny DeVito directed the film adaptation of Roald Dahl's novel 'Matilda', showcasing the story of a brilliant young girl with telekinetic abilities.

Questions.Question: In the film 'The Hunchback of Notre Dame', which classic novel is Quasimodo seen reading?
Questions.Explanation: In the Disney adaptation, Quasimodo is seen reading 'A Tale of Two Cities' by Charles Dickens, reflecting themes of social justice and sacrifice.
